intro: Eriogonum cymosum, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces edible seeds that are used by both wildlife and humans. Eriogonum cymosum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with well-drained soils.
